Specific Details: Further strengthening the positive impact of the Social Housing Strategy for people with disabilities in housing need
Subject Matter: Further strengthening the positive impact of the Social Housing Strategy for people with disabilities in housing need
Intended Results: Bringing urgent attention to unmet disability-specific housing need in the community::Discussing issues relating to the backlogs in applications for housing adaptation grants in relation to social housing tenants who have a disability
Lobbying Activities: 25.05.16 - Phone call with Councillor David Costello informing DFI that the clause “Houses reserved by the local authority for particular reasons (e.g. houses with adaption’s for medical needs, single storey houses etc.)” has been removed from the tenant purchase scheme application. Also highlighted the problem in Dublin City Council of backlogs in applications for housing adaptation grants in relation to social housing tenants who have a disability. The work being carried out, has to be carried out by the Council’s own construction company, and can’t be outsourced creating a backlog.|Phone call|1::12.07.16 - Contacted Senator Lynn Ruane asking for her to support a Motion that was put down for consideration to Seanad Eireann on the 13.07.16 in relation to the need for appropriate housing for people with disabilities.|Informal communication|1::15.06.16 - Email in response to Councillor David Costello's email relating to the length of time tenants are waiting and the legal reason prohibiting Council tenants from carrying out the works under the normal process associated with the disabled persons/housing adaptation grant.|Email|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Joanne McCarthy supported by Joan O'Connor and Dermot O'Donnell

Specific Details: The Disability (Miscellaneous Provisions) Bill
Subject Matter: The Disability (Miscellaneous Provisions) Bill
Intended Results: In the absence of the full implementation of the EPSEN Act, the Disability (Miscellaneous Provisions) Bill should be amended to require the Department of Education and Skills to submit a Sectoral Plan (like that required of other government departments under the existing Disability Act).  This would provide a statutory framework to quantify not only the scale of services provided, but more importantly focus on impact and rights (via monitoring and review procedures, and a complaints procedure).
Lobbying Activities: |Email|2-5::|Meeting|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Rosie Bissett, CEO, Dyslexia Association of Ireland
